topic_metadata.title: How can I enumerate every element function in Typst?

posts.name: OrthoPole
posts.cooked:
I want to list all element functions in Typst.

There seems to be no details about the full list.

Can anyone give me such a list or help me find one?
posts.raw:
I want to list all element functions in Typst.

There seems to be no details about the full list.

Can anyone give me such a list or help me find one?

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
Hello,
I think give or take all “elements” are listed in files like mod.rs. Technically speaking, you can search for occurences of define_elem like so to find all elements.
posts.raw:
Hello,
I think give or take all "elements" are listed in files like [mod.rs](https://github.com/typst/typst/blob/c21c1c391b48f843c8671993a28eaf1fe0d40b89/crates/typst-library/src/model/mod.rs). Technically speaking, you can search for occurences of `define_elem` [like so](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Atypst%2Ftypst+define_elem%3A%3A&type=code) to find all elements.

posts.name: OrthoPole
posts.cooked: Thank you. I found a NativeElement trait in the source code. So elements are structs that implement that trait. There is 129 element functions in total.
posts.raw: Thank you. I found a `NativeElement` trait in the source code. So elements are structs that implement that trait. There is 129 element functions in total.
